name.baseName: Municipal wastewater treatment ; Wastewater ; cyclic activated sludge technique
市政污水处理 ; 废水 ; 循环活性污泥法

dataSetInformation.common:generalComment: In municipal wastewater treatment, the activated sludge process is a commonly used technology. This process involves mixing wastewater containing pollutants with activated sludge and circulating them to degrade and transform organic matter and ammonia nitrogen pollutants into harmless substances through microbial action. In this process, wastewater is introduced into a reactor where it is mixed with activated sludge and exposed to oxygen supply, stimulating the growth and metabolism of microorganisms. Microorganisms utilize organic matter as a carbon and energy source for growth while oxidizing pollutants. The treated water, after processes such as sedimentation and filtration, meets discharge standards, while the recycled activated sludge can be reused in subsequent treatment cycles.

市政污水处理中，循环活性污泥法是一种常用的污水处理技术。该工艺通过将含有污染物的污水与活性污泥混合并循环，使污水中的有机物和氨氮等污染物被微生物降解和转化为无害物质。在此过程中，污水被送入反应器中，与活性污泥混合并暴露于氧气供应下，从而刺激微生物的生长和代谢。微生物利用有机物质作为碳源和能量源进行生长，同时氧化污染物。处理后的水经过沉淀、过滤等步骤后可达到排放标准，同时循环的活性污泥则可以继续用于下一轮的处理过程。

technology.technologyDescriptionAndIncludedProcesse: In municipal wastewater treatment, the Modified Ludzak-Ettinger (MLE) process exhibits the following technical characteristics:Bioreactor Design: The MLE process typically employs multi-stage bioreactors to provide sufficient contact time and oxygen supply, promoting microbial growth and organic matter degradation.Recirculation System: Recirculation systems are utilized in this process to return a portion of treated sludge back to the reactor, increasing microbial concentration and activity, thus enhancing wastewater treatment efficiency.Oxygen Control: Oxygen is a critical factor for microbial growth and organic matter oxidation. Control of oxygen supply and aeration methods need to be adjusted based on influent water quality and treatment requirements to maintain appropriate oxygen concentration and gas-liquid ratio.Mixing and Agitation: Effective mixing systems are essential to maintain uniform mixing in the reactor, ensuring even distribution of wastewater and sludge to improve contact efficiency between wastewater and microorganisms.Operating Conditions: Operating the MLE process requires control of parameters such as temperature, pH, and oxidation-reduction potential within the reactor to maintain microbial growth and activity. Additionally, regular monitoring and adjustment of the system are necessary to cope with fluctuations in influent water quality and operational changes.Related Upstream and Downstream Processes: Upstream processes include pretreatment of wastewater, such as screening, grit removal, and sedimentation, to remove large particles and settleable solids. Downstream processes may involve secondary clarifier sedimentation, filtration, etc., to separate and remove biomass flocs and suspended solids, ultimately producing treated water that meets discharge standards.

市政污水处理中，循环活性污泥法具有以下技术特性：生物反应器设计： 循环活性污泥法通常采用多段式生物反应器，以提供足够的接触时间和氧气供应，促进微生物的生长和有机物的降解。循环系统： 该工艺中使用循环系统将一部分已经处理过的污泥回流到反应器中，以增加微生物的浓度和活性，提高污水处理的效率。氧气控制： 氧气是微生物生长和有机物氧化的关键因素之一，需要根据进水水质和处理需求控制氧气的供应量和曝气方式，以维持适宜的氧气浓度和气液比。搅拌和混合： 为了保持反应器中的混合均匀，需要良好的搅拌系统，以确保污水和污泥的均匀分布，从而提高污水与微生物的接触率。操作条件： 操作循环活性污泥法需要控制好反应器内的温度、pH值、氧化还原电位等参数，以维持微生物的生长和活性。此外，需要定期对系统进行监测和调整，以应对进水水质的变化和处理系统的运行波动。相关上游和下游过程： 上游过程包括污水的预处理，如筛网过滤、格栅过滤和沉淀，以去除大颗粒物和沉淀物。下游过程可能包括二沉池沉淀、滤池过滤等步骤，用于分离和去除生物团块和悬浮物，最终得到符合排放标准的处理水。
technology.technologicalApplicability: The cyclic activated sludge technique is used in wastewater treatment within the Ashihe River Watershed. It is a method employed to remove organic pollutants and nutrients from sewage or industrial wastewater by facilitating the degradation process with microbial biofilms. This technique is applicable in municipal or industrial water treatment facilities aimed at maintaining the ecological balance of the Ashihe River ecosystem.
循环活性污泥法用于阿什河流域的污水处理。这是一种用于通过促进微生物生物膜的降解过程，从污水或工业污水中移除有机污染物和养分的方法。这项技术适用于旨在保持阿什河生态系统平衡的市政或工业水处理设施。

referenceToDataSource.common:shortDescription: Bai, S. et al. Optimization of wastewater treatment strategies using life cycle assessment from a watershed perspective. Journal of Cleaner Production 312, 127784 (2021).
Bai, S. et al. Optimization of wastewater treatment strategies using life cycle assessment from a watershed perspective. Journal of Cleaner Production 312, 127784 (2021).

dataSourcesTreatmentAndRepresentativenes.useAdviceForDataSet: When using the data set related to the cyclic activated sludge technique, users must consider the specific characteristics of wastewater within the Ashihe River Watershed. Local geographical, climatic, and industrial conditions may affect the generalizability of the data. It is important to update data sets regularly to reflect technological improvements and environmental regulations changes. Furthermore, users should also model the potential impacts of the sludge disposal or recycling practices when applying this data.
使用循环活性污泥法的数据集时，用户必须考虑阿什河流域内污水的特定特性。当地的地理、气候和工业条件可能会影响数据的普遍适用性。定期更新数据集以反映技术改进和环境法规的变化非常重要。此外，用户在应用此数据时，还应模拟污泥处置或回收实践的潜在影响。

review.common:reviewDetails: Inventory: The internal review was done by several iteration steps concerning raw data validation, raw data documentation, representativity, completeness and consistency of modelling with regard to ISO 14040 and 14044.
清单： 内部审查通过几个迭代步骤完成，涉及原始数据验证、原始数据记录、代表性、完整性、与 ISO 14040 和 14044 有关的建模的一致性。

publicationAndOwnership.common:licenseType: Free of charge for all users and uses

exchange.generalComment: The original text does not provide information on biogenic and fossil sources. According to experts, it is classified as fossil.
原文未区分biogenic和fossil，根据专家判断此处为biogenic。

referenceToFlowDataSet.common:shortDescription: Suspended solids, unspecified,Suspended solids, unspecified,Suspended solids, unspecified
